sentences.en: A friend accused him of acting like a spiteful child.
sentences.cn: 他的一位朋友责备他举止象个怀恨在心的小孩.

sentences.en: Having the nature of or resulting from malice , deliberately harmful, spiteful.
sentences.cn: 由蓄意害人一起的, 故意的伤害, 恶意的,居心不良的.

sentences.en: He became rebarbative and prickly and spiteful; I find his obsequiousness repellent.
sentences.cn: 他变得令人讨厌、易发怒,怀有恶意; 我发现他的奉承令人厌恶.

sentences.en: He gave her a spiteful pinch.
He has a haunted look, with eyes full of spiteful anger.
sentences.cn: 他表情困惑, 眼睛充满了愤恨.

sentences.en: I believe you're doing it on purpose. Always were a spiteful little fellow.
sentences.cn: 你怕是故意这么干的. 你这小子一向不怀好意.

sentences.en: It means to take spiteful , malicious delight in the misfortune of others.
sentences.cn: 它的意思是把自己的快乐建立在别人的痛苦不幸之上.

sentences.en: It was spiteful of you to tell him that.
sentences.cn: 你告诉他那件事是怀有恶意的.

sentences.en: It was very spiteful of her to do that.
sentences.cn: 她干那件事是怀有恶意的.

sentences.en: Pack it in. Stop being spiteful.
She was plain, spiteful, and surly.
sentences.cn: 她相貌平常, 为人刁恶, 性情乖戾.

sentences.en: She was spiteful and unkind, both to Isabel and to her son.
sentences.cn: 她又恶毒又刻薄，对伊莎贝尔这样，对她的儿子也这样。

sentences.en: The combatants were unequally matched. Elias was anger, Cornelis spiteful.
sentences.cn: 争斗的双方是力量悬殊的.伊莱亚斯怒气冲冲, 科内利斯则居心叵测.

sentences.en: The two old friends were separated for a time by spiteful gossip.
sentences.cn: 流言蜚语曾一时离间了这对老朋友.

trans.tran_cn: 恶意的，居心不良的，故意使人苦恼的，刻毒
trans.tran_en: deliberately nasty to someone in order to hurt or upset them
